page.title: 01Ticehurst Area - Overview
page.content: Ticehurst civil parish is the 1086 Domesday 'Esseswelle'. This block contains the main settlement from Three Leg Cross along the B2099]B2087 ridgeway to Flimwell on the A21. Good rail links with London and the coast are at nearby Wadhurst. Ticehurst is a typical Wealden hilltop village centred round the Square and 13th century St Mary's Church. Timber, brick/tile and stone are local building materials. It is not a tourist village, shops/sevices cater for the local community which with new housing over the last forty years is a good balance of ages and occupations, new and established families. Mixed farming including pick-your- own fruit, commercial woodland, golf course and reservoir with water sports are the main land uses.
